title: Africa: Africa Experiencing Slow Internet Connection, Microsoft Says Issue Being Fixed
description: [Nile Post] Microsoft Africa is close to fixing an outage that's been plaguing users across the continent. The culprit? Damaged undersea fiber optic cables messing with internet traffic.

title: Africa: More Guns, Less Grain As Conflict and Hunger Claim African Lives
description: [ISS] The use of starvation as a weapon of war is reversing decades of improvements in global hunger.

title: Africa: Unveiling the Harambee~Ubuntu Pan-African and Feminist Philanthropies Brand
description: [TrustAfrica] We are proud to announce a significant development in the pan-African and Feminist Philanthropies Initiative emanating from our recent insightful and collaborative strategising meeting in Kenya, from 1-2 March 2024.

title: Africa: Joint Statement On the Proposed Unga Resolution On Seizing the Opportunities of Safe, Secure, and Trustworthy Ai Systems for Sustainable Development
description: [U.S. Mission to the UN] Joint Statement on the Proposed UN General Assembly Resolution on Seizing the Opportunities of Safe, Secure, and Trustworthy Artificial Intelligence Systems for Sustainable Development

title: West Africa: Ecowas Court Dismisses Suit Seeking to Force Nigeria's Support for Haiti's AU Bid
description: [Premium Times] The action was premised on Nigeria's alleged failure to take measures to ensure the admission of Haiti into the African Union at a 2016 Summit of the AU, in Addis Ababa.

title: Africa: Putin Denies Strategy to Spread Influence in Africa After Wagner 'Rebrand'
description: [VOA] London -- Russian President Vladimir Putin has denied he is seeking to oust Western influence in Africa, as new analysis suggests the Kremlin's military intelligence arm has taken over activities of the disbanded Wagner Russian paramilitary group on the continent.

title: Africa: UN Chief Calls for People-Centered Approach to Combat Drug Stigma
description: [UN News] The UN Secretary-General on Thursday called for "putting people first" by ending the stigma and discrimination around those who use drugs and the expansion of prevention and treatment programmes.
